title: 110_s3656
content:
The "Preserving Access to Healthcare (PATH) Act of 2008" is the short title of the Act. The table of contents of the Act is provided. The "Preserving Access to Healthcare (PATH) Act of 2008" includes provisions such as temporary non-application of Medicare phased-out indirect medical education adjustment factor, delay in implementation of Medicaid outpatient hospital services regulation, and delay in phase out of the Medicare hospice budget neutrality adjustment factor. During October 1, 2008, to March 31, 2009, a specific section of the Code of Federal Regulations is temporarily applied without certain restrictions. This does not affect the application of the same section after March 31, 2009. During a 6-month period after enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Health and Human Services is prohibited from finalizing provisions in a proposed rule from 2007. Additionally, the budget neutrality adjustment factor in the Medicare hospice wage index cannot be phased out before April 1, 2009, as stated in a final rule from 2008. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will extend approval and federal funding for California's Medicaid family planning project until June 30, 2009. Certain provisions related to Medicare rural health clinics and federally qualified health centers will be delayed in implementation. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will not take any action before April 1, 2009, to implement certain provisions related to Medicare rural health clinics and federally qualified health centers. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will not implement certain Medicare rural health clinic provisions before April 1, 2009, as outlined in title 42, Code of Federal Regulations. No new rules similar to these provisions will be promulgated. SEC. 7. MANDATORY STATE USE OF NATIONAL CORRECT CODING INITIATIVE. Section 1903(r) of the Social Security Act is amended to incorporate compatible methodologies of the National Correct Coding Initiative for claims filed on or after October 1, 2009. The Secretary shall identify and incorporate compatible methodologies of the National Correct Coding Initiative for claims filed under this title by September 1, 2009. The Secretary must notify States of identified correct coding methodologies and how to incorporate them into claims filed under the title, and submit a report to Congress supporting the identification of these methodologies. The Secretary must notify States of correct coding methodologies and submit a report to Congress. State plans under title XIX of the Social Security Act may need legislative amendments to comply with new requirements, but will not be penalized for not meeting them immediately. SEC. 8. MEDICAID IMPROVEMENT FUND TECHNICAL CORRECTION.

Amends Section 1941(b)(1)(B) of the Social Security Act to correct a technical error in the Supplemental Appropriations Act of 2008.

SEC. 9. FUNDING FOR THE MEDICARE IMPROVEMENT FUND.

Adjusts the funding amount in Section 1898(b)(1) of the Social Security Act as part of the Medicare Improvements for Patients and Providers Act of 2008.
